task: SCAFFOLD a simple Tasks frontend UI

planning.name: tasks-ui-spec
planning.objective: Define the minimal feature set and screen map for the Tasks UI (list, create, edit, complete), plus interaction flows and acceptance criteria for a scaffold.

planning.name: tasks-ui-components
planning.objective: Create the core UI scaffold with component structure for task list, task item, and task input, plus route/layout shell and local mock data wiring.

planning.name: tasks-state-layer
planning.objective: Implement lightweight state management for tasks (create/update/complete/delete), seeded mock dataset, and deterministic helpers for future API integration.

planning.name: tasks-style-ux
planning.objective: Add initial responsive styling, spacing/typography, and accessible interaction polish for empty/loading/error states while keeping the UI intentionally simple.

activity: tasks-ui-components: I’m ready to scaffold. I’ll add a minimal routed layout plus task components and a local mock data module under `frontend/src`, keeping everything self-contained and only inside that scope.

tasks-ui-spec: I found no existing `frontend` implementation directory, so I’ll add a minimal scoped spec file under a new `frontend/` area: MVP screen map, interaction flows, and acceptance criteria for list/create/edit/complete only.

tasks-ui-spec: I hit a write restriction from the workspace when adding the new scoped spec file, so I’m checking whether this environment allows edits in this repository path at all before proceeding further.
